items.title: Magento2: add custom quote extension attribute
items.body:
I am trying to add an extension attribute to a quote through a custom REST API, and I would like to retrieve this info later.

But when I try to get the value, is always null.

The code will explain better than me.

etc/di.xml

<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
          xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="urn:magento:framework:ObjectManager/etc/config.xsd">

[...]

<preference for="Wow\Orderplatform\Api\Data\CartInterface"
               type="Wow\Orderplatform\Model\Cart" />
</config>

etc/extension_attributes.xml

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
  xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="urn:magento:framework:Api/etc/extension_attributes.xsd">
<extension_attributes for="Magento\Quote\Api\Data\CartInterface">
    <attribute code="order_platform" type="Wow\Orderplatform\Api\Data\CartInterface"/>
</extension_attributes>
</config>

CartInterface

interface CartInterface extends ExtensibleDataInterface
{

const ORDER_PLATFORM = 'order_platform';

/**
 * Retrieve order platform
 *
 * @return string
 */
public function getOrderPlatform();

/**
 * Set order platform
 *
 * @param string $orderPlatform
 * @return $this
 */
public function setOrderPlatform($orderPlatform);
}

The implementation:

class Cart extends AbstractExtensibleModel implements CartInterface
{
/**
 * {inheritdoc}
 */
public function getOrderPlatform()
{
    return $this->getData(self::ORDER_PLATFORM);
}

/**
 * {inheritdoc}
 */
public function setOrderPlatform($orderPlatform)
{
    return $this->setData(self::ORDER_PLATFORM, $orderPlatform);
}
}

I try to save the extension attribute in a REST API:

  $quote = $this->quoteRepository->getActive($cartId);
  $extensions = $quote->getExtensionAttributes();
  $platformExt = $this->wowCartExtInterfaceFactory->create();
  $platformExt->setOrderPlatform($platform);
  $extensions->setOrderPlatform($platformExt);
  $quote->setExtensionAttributes($extensions);
  $this->quoteRepository->save($quote);

No errors in this procedure.

The problem is that I am not able to get back the value from the quote:

  $quote = $this->quoteRepository->getActive($cartId);    
  $extensions = $quote->getExtensionAttributes();
  $extensions->getOrderPlatform(); // Always null

Any hints?

Thanks

27 198 277 389 0.86006
33 127 293 354 0.89782

Type(a)
<type 'str'>
len(a) shows it as 22 including splace between 2 numbers

Want to convert them to list
Need as below
b=[[38 186 298 345 0.93345][27 198 277 389 0.86006][33 127 293 354 0.89782]]

I have 3 strings a=38 186 298 345 0.93345 27 198 277 389 0.86006 33 127 293 354 0.89782

Type(a) len(a) shows it as 22 including splace between 2 numbers

Want to convert them to list Need as below b=[[38 186 298 345 0.93345][27 198 277 389 0.86006][33 127 293 354 0.89782]]

items.body_markdown:
I am trying to make a new custom filter in ActiveAdmin of a rails application. When I put bellow code

`filter :premium_scenes_in`

it displays a input field as text input field (with option "contains", "equals" and etc) but I want an input field as numeric with option "equals", "greater than" or "less than".

I tried to use:

`filter :premium_scenes_in, as: :numeric`
or 
`filter :premium_scenes_in, as: :numeric_range`

But each time it shows an error `Unable to find input class NumaricRangeInput` 

This is my code in model 

    ransacker :premium_scenes,
      formatter: proc { |number|
        results = Tour.all.map{|tour| tour if tour.scenes.count > number}
        results = results.present? ? results : nil
       }, splat_params: true do |parent|
      parent.table[:id]
    end
items.title: Numeric custom filter with ransacker is not working
items.body:
I am trying to make a new custom filter in ActiveAdmin of a rails application. When I put bellow code

filter :premium_scenes_in

it displays a input field as text input field (with option "contains", "equals" and etc) but I want an input field as numeric with option "equals", "greater than" or "less than".

I tried to use:

filter :premium_scenes_in, as: :numeric or filter :premium_scenes_in, as: :numeric_range

But each time it shows an error Unable to find input class NumaricRangeInput

This is my code in model 

ransacker :premium_scenes,
  formatter: proc { |number|
    results = Tour.all.map{|tour| tour if tour.scenes.count > number}
    results = results.present? ? results : nil
   }, splat_params: true do |parent|
  parent.table[:id]
end

items.title: Remove text decoration line under image link
items.body:
Does anyone know how to remove this line from images which is showing up in IE

I have removed the images borders and text-decoration from the links using css

body img {
    border:none;
}
a img {
    text-decoration:none;
}

I can't figure out what else could be causing it.

It's not an underscore it is linking to the facebook page.

items.body_markdown:
I've been struggling with putting https on my wordpress website.
I think I've done everything somewhat correctly, the certificate is installed, the htaccess and the apache conf files configurated, domain name changed... but the HTTPS only works on the front page and the wordpress administration pages, and on the other pages of my website it says error 404...
I also tried to use a plugin that would do everything automaticly, but it has the same problem.

Could someone help please?
items.title: wordpress HTTPS working on administration but not on website pages
items.body:
I've been struggling with putting https on my wordpress website. I think I've done everything somewhat correctly, the certificate is installed, the htaccess and the apache conf files configurated, domain name changed... but the HTTPS only works on the front page and the wordpress administration pages, and on the other pages of my website it says error 404... I also tried to use a plugin that would do everything automaticly, but it has the same problem.

Could someone help please?

items.title: Response 400 from Google Vision API OCR with a base64 string of specified image
items.body:
I've read How to use the Google Vision API for text detection from base64 encoded image? but it doesn't help at all. Cloud client library is undesirable for me because I am doing many image processing (e.g. rotating, cropping, resizing, etc.) before and during OCR. Saving them as new files and re-read them as inputs of Google Vision API is rather inefficient.

Hence, I went check the documentation of posting requests directly:

  • Using Python to send requests
  • Base64 Encoding
  • Optical character recognition (OCR),

and here are minimum codes to make the failure:

import base64
import requests
import io

# Read the image file and transform it into a base64 string
with io.open("photos/foo.jpg", 'rb') as image_file:
    image = image_file.read()
content = base64.b64encode(image)

# Prepare the data for request
# Format copied from https://cloud.google.com/vision/docs/ocr
sending_request = {
  "requests": [
    {
      "image": {
        "content": content
      },
      "features": [
        {
          "type": "TEXT_DETECTION"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

# Send the request and get the response
# Format copied from https://cloud.google.com/vision/docs/using-python
response = requests.post(
    url='https://vision.googleapis.com/v1/images:annotate?key={}'.format(API_KEY),
    data=sending_request,
    headers={'Content-Type': 'application/json'}
)

# Then get 400 code
response
# <Response [400]>
print(response.text)
{
  "error": {
    "code": 400,
    "message": "Invalid JSON payload received. Unexpected token.\nrequests=image&reque\n^",
    "status": "INVALID_ARGUMENT"
  }
}

I went to my console and see there are indeed request errors for google.cloud.vision.v1.ImageAnnotator.BatchAnnotateImages, but I don't know what happened. Is it because the wrong format of sent data in requests.post?

items.body_markdown: I have large Perl application running on SOLARIS 10 and Perl 5.8.9. Application uses 30 modules. I would like to migrate Perl application to new environment - SOLARIS 11. Perl environment on SOLARIS 11 will use last stable release of Perl. What is best strategy to install Perl modules? Shall I use module version from old environment or install newer version of Perl modules? Thank you.

Or is there a better way?

items.title: Is there an easy way to pickle a python function (or otherwise serialize its code)?
items.body:
I'm trying to transfer a function across a network connection (using asyncore). Is there an easy way to serialize a python function (one that, in this case at least, will have no side affects) for transfer like this?

I would ideally like to have a pair of functions similar to these:

def transmit(func):
    obj = pickle.dumps(func)
    [send obj across the network]

def receive():
    [receive obj from the network]
    func = pickle.loads(s)
    func()

items.body_markdown:
I have a keras model (using R) and TF as backend as follows

	history <- model %>% fit( train_X1,train_y,batch_size=100,
				   epochs=80,validation_split = 0.2,
				   shuffle=TRUE)

	> class(model)
	[1] "keras.models.Sequential"         "keras.engine.training.Model"    
	[3] "keras.engine.topology.Container" "keras.engine.topology.Layer"    
	[5] "python.builtin.object" 			   

The dimensions are as follows:

	> dim(train_X1)
	[1] 4893   64   64    1
	> dim(train_y)
	[1] 4893   12

I am trying to evaluate and predict first on train set and then on test set.

	model %>% evaluate(train_X1,train_y)
    pred <- model %>% predict_classes(train_X1)
however I am getting the following error on running the evaluate command:

    Error in do.call(object$evaluate, args) :  'what' must be a function or character string

Any help will be appreciated. Thanks

history <- model %>% fit( train_X1,train_y,batch_size=100,
               epochs=80,validation_split = 0.2,
               shuffle=TRUE)

> class(model)

however I am getting the following error on running the evaluate command:

Any help will be appreciated. Thanks

items.body_markdown:
I have written a test c++ program for running an ARM target. I am using Linaro gcc-linaro-arm-linux-gnueabihf-4.8-2013.07-1 cross compiler on Windows in eclipse IDE to compile the hello world program. The below is the compile options used by eclipse:

    14:28:26 **** Incremental Build of configuration Debug for project test ****
    make all 
    Building file: ../main.cpp
    Invoking: Cross G++ Compiler
    arm-linux-gnueabihf-g++ -O0 -g1 -Wall -c -fmessage-length=0 -std=c++11 -MMD -MP -MF"main.d" -MT"main.o" -o "main.o" "../main.cpp"
    Finished building: ../main.cpp
     
    Building target: test
    Invoking: Cross G++ Linker
    arm-linux-gnueabihf-g++  -o "test"  ./main.o   
    Finished building target: test
     
    
    14:28:27 Build Finished (took 848ms)
Now when I try to run the program in a arm target it just doesn't do anything, i.e. simply returns to the linux prompt without any output. I did a ldd on the binary it shows that there are dynamic libraries (libm.so.6 and libc.so.6) missing on the target linux machine. I double checked the buildroot directory it doesn't exists there. 
The below is the output from the ldd command:

    # ldd test-prog
    checking sub-depends for '/lib/libpthread.so.0'
            libc.so.0 => /lib//libc.so.0 (0x4000e000)
            ld-uClibc.so.0 => /lib//ld-uClibc.so.0 (0x40000000)
    checking sub-depends for '/usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6'
    checking sub-depends for 'not found'
    checking sub-depends for '/lib/libgcc_s.so.1'
    checking sub-depends for 'not found'
    checking sub-depends for '/lib//libm.so.0'
            libc.so.0 => /lib//libc.so.0 (0x4000e000)
            ld-uClibc.so.0 => /lib//ld-uClibc.so.0 (0x40000000)
    checking sub-depends for '/lib//libc.so.0'
            ld-uClibc.so.0 => /lib//ld-uClibc.so.0 (0x40000000)
            libpthread.so.0 => /lib/libpthread.so.0 (0x00000000)
            libstdc++.so.6 => /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6 (0x00000000)
            libm.so.6 => not found (0x00000000)
            libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00000000)
            libc.so.6 => not found (0x00000000)
            libm.so.0 => /lib//libm.so.0 (0x00000000)
            libc.so.0 => /lib//libc.so.0 (0x00000000)
            /lib//ld-uClibc.so.0 => /lib//ld-uClibc.so.0 (0x00000000)
If I use an older version of the g++ compiler (arm-linux-g++ -v => gcc version 4.3.5) the binary runs fine on the target. But I need the higher version of the compiler because 4.3.5 doesn't support c++11. Can you please suggest how to install the libm.so.6 and libc.so.6. The buildroot I am using is buildroot-2010.08. I don't think changing the buildroot would be an option as the customer would not agree with that. Need to fit the library in the buildroot-2010.08. Any idea please share.
items.title: How to install libm.so.6 on a rootfs built for arm target with buildroot?
items.body:
I have written a test c++ program for running an ARM target. I am using Linaro gcc-linaro-arm-linux-gnueabihf-4.8-2013.07-1 cross compiler on Windows in eclipse IDE to compile the hello world program. The below is the compile options used by eclipse:

14:28:26 **** Incremental Build of configuration Debug for project test ****
make all 
Building file: ../main.cpp
Invoking: Cross G++ Compiler
arm-linux-gnueabihf-g++ -O0 -g1 -Wall -c -fmessage-length=0 -std=c++11 -MMD -MP -MF"main.d" -MT"main.o" -o "main.o" "../main.cpp"
Finished building: ../main.cpp

Building target: test
Invoking: Cross G++ Linker
arm-linux-gnueabihf-g++  -o "test"  ./main.o   
Finished building target: test


14:28:27 Build Finished (took 848ms)

Now when I try to run the program in a arm target it just doesn't do anything, i.e. simply returns to the linux prompt without any output. I did a ldd on the binary it shows that there are dynamic libraries (libm.so.6 and libc.so.6) missing on the target linux machine. I double checked the buildroot directory it doesn't exists there. The below is the output from the ldd command:

# ldd test-prog
checking sub-depends for '/lib/libpthread.so.0'
        libc.so.0 => /lib//libc.so.0 (0x4000e000)

items.body_markdown:
My data looks like this:

    [column "content"]
    The quick red horse jumps over the quick dog
    The quick brown horse
    The quick brown horse jumps over the lazy dog
    The quick brown horses jumps over the dog
    quick as a mouse was the spider. The horse is brown.

I use MATCH and AGAINST to get all rows with horse and horses. So, I know, the wildcard* works in BOOLEAN MODE.

    SELECT * FROM news
    WHERE 	(MATCH (content) AGAINST ('+quick +horse*' IN BOOLEAN MODE));


With the next query I get all rows with "horses" (plural) and "quick", having a distance by a maximum of 3.

    SELECT * FROM news
    WHERE 	(MATCH (content) AGAINST  ('"quick horses" @3' IN BOOLEAN MODE));

The is to combine both together: all horse or horses AND and "quick", having a distance by a maximum of 3.

    SELECT * FROM news
    WHERE 	(MATCH (content) AGAINST  ('"quick horse*" @3' IN BOOLEAN MODE));

In the result set only rows included with "horse". "horses" not included!

Full documentation see: http://sqlfiddle.com/#!9/033e02/6 

Does somebody has any idea?
items.title: MySQL Fulltext search: Using distance with wildcards
items.body:
My data looks like this:

[column "content"]
The quick red horse jumps over the quick dog
The quick brown horse
The quick brown horse jumps over the lazy dog
The quick brown horses jumps over the dog
quick as a mouse was the spider. The horse is brown.

I use MATCH and AGAINST to get all rows with horse and horses. So, I know, the wildcard* works in BOOLEAN MODE.

SELECT * FROM news
WHERE   (MATCH (content) AGAINST ('+quick +horse*' IN BOOLEAN MODE));

With the next query I get all rows with "horses" (plural) and "quick", having a distance by a maximum of 3.

SELECT * FROM news
WHERE   (MATCH (content) AGAINST  ('"quick horses" @3' IN BOOLEAN MODE));

The is to combine both together: all horse or horses AND and "quick", having a distance by a maximum of 3.

SELECT * FROM news
WHERE   (MATCH (content) AGAINST  ('"quick horse*" @3' IN BOOLEAN MODE));

In the result set only rows included with "horse". "horses" not included!

Full documentation see: http://sqlfiddle.com/#!9/033e02/6

Does somebody has any idea?

items.title: Script Error Suppress in Browser Control not working
items.body:
I am working on an app that uses browser control to display web sites and I have been trying to suppress the script debugging pop-up with no luck. I have read several posts including Microsoft documentation and those solutions don't work. I need to be able to suppress these pop-ups while allowing log in window to show. The method SuppressScriptErrorsOnly() is the current solution I am using to suppress the error but I had no luck with it so far. 

using System;
using System.Diagnostics;
using System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis;
using System.Drawing;
using System.Globalization;
using System.Windows.Forms;
using System.Linq.Expressions;

{

    //**************************************************************************
    public class LxWebRhsDisplay : UserControl, LxiRhsDisplay
    {
        private const int WEB_DISPLAY_WIDTH = 1600;
        private const int WEB_DISPLAY_HEIGHT = 1500;
        private static readonly Uri URI_BLANK = new Uri("about:blank");


        private WebBrowser m_webDisplay;

        private Uri m_url;

        #region Designer-generated variables
        private Panel m_webBrowserPanel;
        private ToolStrip m_toolStrip;
        private ToolStripButton m_launchBtn;
        private ToolStripButton m_refreshBtn;
        /// <summary>Required designer variable.</summary>
        private System.ComponentModel.IContainer components = null;
        #endregion Designer-generated variables


        public LxWebRhsDisplay ()
        {
            InitializeComponent();

            // Set some UI properties that cannot be set in the Designer.
            m_launchBtn.Image = LxNformImagesMgr.GetViewWebBtnImage(
                                    LxWinFormsImagesMgr.ButtonState.Normal);
            this.m_launchBtn.BackColor = Color.Black;
            this.m_launchBtn.ForeColor = Color.Gray;
            this.m_refreshBtn.BackColor = Color.Black;
            this.m_refreshBtn.ForeColor = Color.Gray;
            m_refreshBtn.Image = LxNformImagesMgr.GetRefreshBtnImage(
                                    LxWinFormsImagesMgr.ButtonState.Normal);
            this.m_toolStrip.Renderer = new LxToolStripRenderer();
            // Configure the scroll bars to match the web page's size.
            CfgScrollBars();
            m_webBrowserPanel.HorizontalScroll.Value = 0;
            m_webBrowserPanel.VerticalScroll.Value = 0;

        } // end ctor


        public LxiRunDev CurrentDevice
        {
            get { return this.m_runDev; }
        }

        [SuppressMessage("Microsoft.Performance", "CA1811:AvoidUncalledPrivateCode",
            Justification="Properties requiring setters should always have getters.")]
        private bool IsDirty
        {
            get { return this.m_isDirty; }
            set { this.m_isDirty = value; }
        }


        #region LxiRhsDisplay Interface members


        public LxBaseNavViewTreeNode CurrentNode
        {
            get { return this.m_node; }
            set 
            {
                if (value != this.m_node)
                {
                    this.m_node = value;
                    this.m_runDev = (LxiRunDev)value.Tag;
                    this.IsDirty = true;
                }
            }
        }


        public bool InView
        {
            get { return this.m_inView; }
            set
            {
                this.m_inView = value;

                // Check if data retrieval is necessary.
                if (!this.m_inView)
                {
                    // Dispose the web browser instance.
                    this.Clear();
                    return;
                }

                // Becoming visible -- get the device URI.
                Uri uri = GetDeviceUri();
                if (uri == null) return;

                // Show the configured web page after first clearing the display.
                this.ClearAndNavigate (uri);

                // Configure the scroll bars to match the web page's size.
                CfgScrollBars ();
                m_webBrowserPanel.HorizontalScroll.Value = 0;
                m_webBrowserPanel.VerticalScroll.Value = 0;

                IsDirty = false;
                return;
            }
        } // end InView


        public void Clear ()
        {
            this.Navigate(URI_BLANK);
        }


        public void PrepareRhsDisplay ()
        {
            // Nothing to do here.
            return;
        }

        #endregion LxiRhsDisplay Interface members



        protected override void Dispose (bool disposing)
        {
            if (IsDisposed) return;

            if (disposing)
            {
                if (components != null)
                {
                    components.Dispose();
                }
                // Dispose the web server component.
                if (null != this.m_webDisplay)
                {
                    m_webDisplay.Dispose ();    m_webDisplay = null;
                }
                this.m_webBrowserPanel.Dispose();
            }

            base.Dispose(disposing);
        } // end Dispose

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// Raises the form's <see cref="System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateControl"/>
        /// event.
        /// </summary>
        protected override void OnCreateControl ()
        {
            // First, call our base class' method.
            base.OnCreateControl ();

            // Set the localized labels.
            if (!DesignMode)
            {
                this.m_launchBtn.Text= LxViewerStrings.GetString
                                    (LxViewerStrings.WEBDISPLAY_VIEWINBRWSR_BTN);
                this.m_refreshBtn.Text =  LxViewerStrings.GetString
                                        (LxViewerStrings.PRMDATA_REFRESH_BTN);
                this.m_toolStrip.Font = LxForm.DefaultFont;

                // Set some WebBrowser control properties that may cause
                // exceptions to be thrown if set too early.
                m_webDisplay.AllowWebBrowserDrop = false;
                m_webDisplay.IsWebBrowserContextMenuEnabled = false;
                m_webDisplay.ScrollBarsEnabled = false;
                //m_webDisplay.WebBrowserShortcutsEnabled = false;

                m_webDisplay.ScriptErrorsSuppressed = false;

            }
            return;
        } // end OnCreateControl

        private void SuppressScriptErrorsOnly()
        {
            if (this.m_webDisplay.Document != null && this.m_webDisplay.Document.Window != null)
                this.m_webDisplay.Document.Window.Error += (o, args) => args.Handled = true;
        }

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// Gets the device uri for the <see cref="CurrentDevice"/>.
        /// </summary>
        /// <returns><see cref="Uri"/> associated with current
        /// <see cref="LxRunDev"/> instance.</returns>
        private Uri GetDeviceUri ()
        {
            LxiRunDev runDev = this.CurrentDevice;
            Uri uri = runDev.DeviceUri;
            if (uri == null)
            {
                // No specific URI -- use the device's address.
                Debug.Assert (!String.IsNullOrEmpty(runDev.Address),
                                "No address for device");
                // TODO : These filter need to be placed in common class.
                // Removing the entries after '|' character for web display.
                char[] addrSeparator = new char[] {'|'};
                string uriAddr = runDev.Address.Split(addrSeparator)[0];
                uri = LxViewerUtils.GetUri (uriAddr, false);
            }
            return uri;
        }

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// Configures the scroll bars around the web page display.
        /// </summary>
        private void CfgScrollBars ()
        {
            // Configure the scroll bars to match the web page's size.
            // TODO: Can this be made dynamic to the actual web page's size?
            int range = WEB_DISPLAY_WIDTH;
            m_webBrowserPanel.HorizontalScroll.Enabled = true;
            m_webBrowserPanel.HorizontalScroll.LargeChange = (range / 5);
            m_webBrowserPanel.HorizontalScroll.Maximum = range;
            m_webBrowserPanel.HorizontalScroll.SmallChange = (range / 25);
            m_webBrowserPanel.HorizontalScroll.Visible = true;
            range = WEB_DISPLAY_HEIGHT;
            m_webBrowserPanel.VerticalScroll.Enabled = true;
            m_webBrowserPanel.VerticalScroll.LargeChange = (range / 5);
            m_webBrowserPanel.VerticalScroll.Maximum = range;
            m_webBrowserPanel.VerticalScroll.SmallChange = (range / 25);
            m_webBrowserPanel.VerticalScroll.Visible = true;
            return;
        } // end CfgScrollBars

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// Handles EnabledChanged event of <c>LxButton</c> in
        /// <see cref="LxWebRhsDisplay"/>.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="sender">The source of the event.</param>
        /// <param name="ea">An <see cref="System.EventArgs"/> that contains
        /// the event data.</param>
        private void HandleEnableChanged (object sender, EventArgs ea)
        {
            ToolStripButton btn = sender as ToolStripButton;
            Debug.Assert ((btn != null), "Unexpected sender type");
            if (btn != null)  btn.BackColor = Color.DarkGray;
        }

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// Web browser control's SizeChanged event handler.
        /// </summary>
        /// <remarks>
        /// Re-configures the scroll bars to keep them available (visible?).
        /// </remarks>
        /// <param name="sender">The source of the event.</param>
        /// <param name="ea">An <see cref="EventArgs"/> that
        /// contains the event data.</param>
        private void WebBrowserPanel_SizeChanged (object sender, EventArgs ea)
        {
            CfgScrollBars ();
        }

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// <see cref="WebBrowser.DocumentCompleted"/> event handler.
        /// </summary>
        /// <remarks>
        /// This handler is used to implement <see cref="ClearAndNavigate"/>.
        /// That method navigates to <see cref="URI_BLANK"/>.  Once that loads,
        /// this method executes, navigating to <see cref="m_url"/>.
        /// </remarks>
        /// <param name="sender">The source of the event.</param>
        /// <param name="ea">A <see cref="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserDocumentCompletedEventArgs"/>
        /// object that contains the event data.</param>
        private void WebBrowser_DocumentCompletedHandler
        (
            object sender,
            WebBrowserDocumentCompletedEventArgs ea
        )
        {
            if (ea.Url.Equals(URI_BLANK) &&
                (m_url != null) && !m_url.Equals(URI_BLANK))
            {
                Navigate(m_url);
            }
        }

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// First navigates to <see cref="URI_BLANK"/>, then to the specified
        /// <paramref name="url"/> once that completes.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="url">The URL to navigate to after clearing the
        /// display.</param>
        private void ClearAndNavigate (Uri url)
        {
            if (IsDisposed) return;

            m_url = url;
            NavigateImpl(URI_BLANK);
        }

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// Navigates the specified <paramref name="url"/> in the web browser.
        /// </summary>
        /// <remarks>
        /// This also resets/clears the URL stored by <see cref="ClearAndNavigate"/>
        /// </remarks>
        /// <param name="url">Url to be navigated.</param>
        private void Navigate (Uri url)
        {
            if (IsDisposed) return;

            m_url = null;
            NavigateImpl(url);
        }

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// Navigates the specified <paramref name="url"/> in the web browser.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="url">Url to be navigated.</param>
        private void NavigateImpl (Uri url)
        {
            if (this.IsDisposed) return;
            //Here I attempt to suppress the script error with no luck
            SuppressScriptErrorsOnly();
            try
            {
                this.m_webDisplay.Navigate(url);
            }
            catch (InvalidOperationException e)
            {
                string failedMessage = 
                    LxViewerStrings.GetString(LxViewerStrings.WEBDISPLAY_BRWSRERR_MSG);

                string message = string.Format(
                    CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture,
                    failedMessage,
                    Environment.NewLine,
                    e.Message);

                LxMessageBox.Show<LxViewerStrings>(
                    this,
                    message,
                    LxViewerStrings.OPERATION_FAILED_TITLE,
                    MessageBoxIcon.Error);

                return;
            }

            // Not caught: ObjectDisposedException since web browser instance
            // will always be there.
        }

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// "View in Default Browser..." button Click event handler.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="sender">The source of the event.</param>
        /// <param name="ea">An <see cref="EventArgs"/> that
        /// contains the event data.</param>
        private void LaunchBtn_Click (object sender,EventArgs ea)
        {
            // Get the device URI.
            Uri uri = this.GetDeviceUri();

            if (null != uri)
            {
                // Start the web page in the default web browser.
                LxViewerUtils.StartUri(uri);
            }
        }

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// "View in Default Browser..." button MouseEnter event handler.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="sender">The source of the event.</param>
        /// <param name="ea">An <see cref="EventArgs"/> that
        /// contains the event data.</param>
        private void LaunchBtn_MouseEnter (object sender, EventArgs ea)
        {
            if (sender == m_launchBtn)
            {
                m_launchBtn.Image = LxNformImagesMgr.GetViewWebBtnImage(
                                    LxWinFormsImagesMgr.ButtonState.Hover);
            }
            m_launchBtn.ForeColor = Color.White;
        }

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// "View in Default Browser..." button MouseLeave event handler.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="sender">The source of the event.</param>
        /// <param name="ea">An <see cref="EventArgs"/> that
        /// contains the event data.</param>
        private void LaunchBtn_MouseLeave (object sender, EventArgs ea)
        {
            if (sender == m_launchBtn)
            {
                m_launchBtn.Image = LxNformImagesMgr.GetViewWebBtnImage(
                                    LxWinFormsImagesMgr.ButtonState.Normal);
            }
            m_launchBtn.ForeColor = Color.Gray;
        }

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// "Refresh" button Click event handler.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="sender">The source of the event.</param>
        /// <param name="ea">An <see cref="EventArgs"/> that
        /// contains the event data.</param>
        private void RefreshBtn_Click (object sender, EventArgs ea)
        {
            this.m_webDisplay.Refresh();
        }

        //**********************************************************************
        /// <summary>
        /// "Refresh" button MouseEnter event handler.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="sender">The source of the event.</param>
        /// <param name="ea">An <see cref="EventArgs"/> that
        /// contains the event data.</param>
        private void RefreshBtn_MouseEnter (object sender, EventArgs ea)
        {
            if (sender == m_refreshBtn)
            {
                m_refreshBtn.Image = LxNformImagesMgr.GetRefreshBtnImage(
                                    LxWinFormsImagesMgr.ButtonState.Hover);
            }
            m_refreshBtn.ForeColor = Color.White;
        }


        private void RefreshBtn_MouseLeave (object sender, EventArgs ea)
        {
            if (sender == m_refreshBtn)
            {
                m_refreshBtn.Image = LxNformImagesMgr.GetRefreshBtnImage(
                                    LxWinFormsImagesMgr.ButtonState.Normal);
            }
            m_refreshBtn.ForeColor = Color.Gray;
        }


        private void InitializeComponent ()
        {
            this.m_webBrowserPanel = new System.Windows.Forms.Panel();
            this.m_webDisplay = new System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser();
            this.m_toolStrip = new System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip();
            this.m_launchBtn = new System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton();
            this.m_refreshBtn = new System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton();
            this.m_webBrowserPanel.SuspendLayout();
            this.m_toolStrip.SuspendLayout();
            this.SuspendLayout();
            // 
            // m_webBrowserPanel
            // 
            this.m_webBrowserPanel.Controls.Add(this.m_webDisplay);
            this.m_webBrowserPanel.Dock = System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle.Fill;
            this.m_webBrowserPanel.Location = new System.Drawing.Point(0,25);
            this.m_webBrowserPanel.Name = "m_webBrowserPanel";
            this.m_webBrowserPanel.Size = new System.Drawing.Size(643,473);
            this.m_webBrowserPanel.TabIndex = 1;
            this.m_webBrowserPanel.SizeChanged += new System.EventHandler(this.WebBrowserPanel_SizeChanged);
            // 
            // m_webDisplay
            // 
            this.m_webDisplay.Location = new System.Drawing.Point(0,0);
            this.m_webDisplay.MinimumSize = new System.Drawing.Size(20,20);
            this.m_webDisplay.Name = "m_webDisplay";
            this.m_webDisplay.Size = new System.Drawing.Size(1600,1500);
            this.m_webDisplay.TabIndex = 0;
            this.m_webDisplay.DocumentCompleted += new System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserDocumentCompletedEventHandler(this.WebBrowser_DocumentCompletedHandler);
            // 
            // m_toolStrip
            // 
            this.m_toolStrip.BackColor = System.Drawing.Color.Black;
            this.m_toolStrip.GripMargin = new System.Windows.Forms.Padding(0);
            this.m_toolStrip.GripStyle = System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripGripStyle.Hidden;
            this.m_toolStrip.Items.AddRange(new System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem[] {
            this.m_launchBtn,
            this.m_refreshBtn});
            this.m_toolStrip.Location = new System.Drawing.Point(0,0);
            this.m_toolStrip.Name = "m_toolStrip";
            this.m_toolStrip.ShowItemToolTips = false;
            this.m_toolStrip.Size = new System.Drawing.Size(643,25);
            this.m_toolStrip.TabIndex = 2;
            // 
            // m_launchBtn
            // 
            this.m_launchBtn.Alignment = System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemAlignment.Right;
            this.m_launchBtn.BackColor = System.Drawing.SystemColors.ControlText;
            this.m_launchBtn.ForeColor = System.Drawing.Color.Black;
            this.m_launchBtn.Name = "m_launchBtn";
            this.m_launchBtn.Size = new System.Drawing.Size(23,22);
            this.m_launchBtn.MouseLeave += new System.EventHandler(this.LaunchBtn_MouseLeave);
            this.m_launchBtn.MouseEnter += new System.EventHandler(this.LaunchBtn_MouseEnter);
            this.m_launchBtn.Click += new System.EventHandler(this.LaunchBtn_Click);
            // 
            // m_refreshBtn
            // 
            this.m_refreshBtn.BackColor = System.Drawing.SystemColors.ControlText;
            this.m_refreshBtn.ForeColor = System.Drawing.Color.Black;
            this.m_refreshBtn.Name = "m_refreshBtn";
            this.m_refreshBtn.Size = new System.Drawing.Size(23,22);
            this.m_refreshBtn.EnabledChanged += new System.EventHandler(this.HandleEnableChanged);
            this.m_refreshBtn.MouseLeave += new System.EventHandler(this.RefreshBtn_MouseLeave);
            this.m_refreshBtn.MouseEnter += new System.EventHandler(this.RefreshBtn_MouseEnter);
            this.m_refreshBtn.Click += new System.EventHandler(this.RefreshBtn_Click);
            // 
            // LxWebRhsDisplay
            // 
            this.Controls.Add(this.m_webBrowserPanel);
            this.Controls.Add(this.m_toolStrip);
            this.Name = "LxWebRhsDisplay";
            this.Size = new System.Drawing.Size(643,498);
            this.m_webBrowserPanel.ResumeLayout(false);
            this.m_toolStrip.ResumeLayout(false);
            this.m_toolStrip.PerformLayout();
            this.ResumeLayout(false);
            this.PerformLayout();

        }

        #endregion

    } // end class LxWebRhsDisplay

} // end namespace Liebert.MG.Nform.Viewer

items.title: Select2 Ajax for wordpress categories
items.body:
I use Frontend Publishing Pro plugin for Wordpress. I created a form in this plugin that allows users to create a post. My problem is that I have more than 15,000 categories. And the good solution for me is to use select2. But in google chrome it's terribly slow if I choose the last elements of the list. There is more than 10 seconds to complete the selection. I searched and found a solution to this problem, they recommend that I use AJAX. I found these places: this, and this. Why does not it work? What's wrong with the code? Should this be a hook? Can anyone help me?

My html that the plugin generates:

<div class="frontend-item-container" style="" data-element-key="category">
<label for="frontend-form-1-post-data-taxonomy-terms-category-">Select category</label>
            <div class="frontend-item-messages "></div>
    <div class="frontend-form-field-container" style="">
            <select class="js-validated-field post-data-taxonomy-terms-category- element-select-with-search" name="post_data[taxonomy_terms][category][]" id="frontend-form-1-post-data-taxonomy-terms-category-" data-placeholder="category" data-allow-clear="true" data-minimum-results-for-search="0" data-maximum-selection-length="" data-language="hu" data-tags="false" data-width="100%" data-container-css-class="select-with-search-container" data-dropdown-css-class="select-with-search-dropdown">
                                            <option value="" selected="selected"></option>
                                            <option value="001">"..."</option>
                                            ...
            </select>
    </div>
</div>

My script

$('#frontend-form-1-post-data-taxonomy-terms-category-').select2({
    ajax: {
            url: ajaxurl, 
            dataType: 'json',
            delay: 250, 
            data: function (params) {
                return {
                    q: params.term, 
                    page: params.page
                };
            },
                processResults: function(data, params) {

                params.page = params.page || 1;

                return {
                results: data.items,
                pagination: {
                more: (params.page * 30) < data.total_count
    }
  };
},
        cache: true
    },
    minimumInputLength: 3 
});

items.title: Browsermob rest plugin - How to avoid part of har file being encryted?
items.body:
I'm using browsermob proxy integrate with JUnit test to get the network traffic which is exported as har file. I can get my har file successfully, however, there is one section "text" is being encrypted. How can I avoid this in my har file? can anyone help me?

Below is my Junit test:

package DataAnalytics.Events;

import BaseTests.BaseTest;
import common.Application;
import java.io.File;
import java.net.UnknownHostException;
import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
import net.lightbody.bmp.BrowserMobProxyServer;
import net.lightbody.bmp.client.ClientUtil;
import net.lightbody.bmp.mitm.manager.ImpersonatingMitmManager;
import net.lightbody.bmp.proxy.CaptureType;
import net.serenitybdd.junit.runners.SerenityRunner;
import net.thucydides.core.annotations.Story;
import org.junit.Test;
import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
import org.openqa.selenium.Proxy;
import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver;
import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeOptions;
import org.openqa.selenium.remote.CapabilityType;
import org.openqa.selenium.remote.DesiredCapabilities;

@Story(Application.Example.Examples.class)
@RunWith(SerenityRunner.class)
public class BrowserMobExample extends BaseTest {
    String strFilePath = "pathToGenerateHarFile";
    static String driverPath = "pathToYourChromeDriver";

@Test
public void main() throws Exception {

    BrowserMobProxyServer browserMobProxy = new BrowserMobProxyServer();
    browserMobProxy.setTrustAllServers(true);
    browserMobProxy.setMitmManager(
            ImpersonatingMitmManager.builder().trustAllServers(true).build());
    browserMobProxy.start(0);

    System.out.println("Port Started On: " + browserMobProxy.getPort());
    browserMobProxy.enableHarCaptureTypes(CaptureType.REQUEST_CONTENT,
            CaptureType.RESPONSE_CONTENT, CaptureType.RESPONSE_HEADERS);

    WebDriver driver = getDriver_CapProxy(browserMobProxy);

    browserMobProxy.newHar("11");
    driver.navigate().to("https://www.google.com");
    Thread.sleep(15000);

    driver.quit();

    browserMobProxy.stop();

    browserMobProxy.getHar().writeTo(new File(strFilePath));

    System.out.println("Loaded browser ");
}

public static WebDriver getDriver_CapProxy(BrowserMobProxyServer browserMobProxy)
        throws UnknownHostException {
    Proxy proxy = ClientUtil.createSeleniumProxy(browserMobProxy);
    proxy.setHttpProxy("localhost:" + browserMobProxy.getPort());
    proxy.setProxyType(Proxy.ProxyType.MANUAL);
    proxy.setSslProxy("localhost:" + browserMobProxy.getPort());
    DesiredCapabilities cap = DesiredCapabilities.chrome();

    ChromeOptions options = new ChromeOptions();
    options.addArguments("--ignore-certificate-errors");
    cap.setCapability(ChromeOptions.CAPABILITY, options);
    cap.setCapability(CapabilityType.PROXY, proxy);

    WebDriver driver = new ChromeDriver(cap);

    driver.manage().timeouts().implicitlyWait(10, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
    return driver;
}
}

Below is an example of my har file:

"content":{ "size":1599, "mimeType":"text/html", "text":"\n\u000B\n\tTranslate\u0012\u0012\b\t\u0012\u0012\rs?\u0015j?

My maven dependency:

<dependency>
        <groupId>net.lightbody.bmp</groupId>
        <artifactId>browsermob-rest</artifactId>
        <version>2.1.5</version>
    </dependency>

items.title: Interpretation of the SAS code meaning
items.body:
Please, help me to interpret the SAS code (I am quite new to sas):

DATA sample;

 SET sample;

   v_eq = mve;

   est_v_eq = v_eq;


   sig_eq = sige;



   WHERE optosey > 0 AND

    optprcey > 0; 

RUN;

Interpretation: Use "sample" - database. Define "v_eq = mve", "est_v_eq = v_eq", "sig_eq = sige" only for observations that have optosey > 0 AND optprcey > 0, am I right? What is confusing is that why do "they" define "v_eq = mve", "est_v_eq = v_eq" and not directly "v_eq = mve" ?

items.title: React Big Calendar how to style a single day in the month view
items.body:
So as seen on the picture, I want to style individual events.

Example of how it should look

With the slotpropgetter it's possible to conditionally render styles.

slotPropGetter = date => {
    const CURRENT_DATE = moment().toDate();
    let backgroundColor;

    if (moment(date).isBefore(CURRENT_DATE, "month")) {
        backgroundColor = "#f7f8f9";
    }

    var style = {
        backgroundColor
    };
    return {
        style: style
    };
};

So the "solution" is the DateCellWrapper, it either doesn't work for me, or I've implemented it in the wrong way

const DateCellWrapper = ({ value, children }) => {
    console.log("DateCellWrapper")
    const style = {
        backgroundColor: "#000",
    };

    return (
        <div style={style}>{children}</div>
    );
}

It doesn't even output my console.log, so.. anyone an idea? :p

items.body_markdown:
I have the following problem:

I have an autoencoder in Keras, and train it for a few epochs. The training overview shows a validation MAE of 0.0422 and an MSE of 0.0024. 
However, if I then call network.predict and manually calculate the validation errors, I get 0.035 and 0.0024. 

One would assume that my manual calculation of the MAE is simply incorrect, but the weird thing is that if I use an identity model (simply outputs what you input) and use that to evaluate the predicted values, the same error value is returned as for my manual calculation. The code looks as follows:

<!-- language-all: lang-python -->

    input = Input(shape=(X_train.shape[1], ))
	encoded = Dense(50, activation='relu', activity_regularizer=regularizers.l1(10e-5))(input)
	encoded = Dense(50, activation='relu', activity_regularizer=regularizers.l1(10e-5))(encoded)
	encoded = Dense(50, activation='relu', activity_regularizer=regularizers.l1(10e-5))(encoded)
	decoded = Dense(50, activation='relu', activity_regularizer=regularizers.l1(10e-5))(encoded)
	decoded = Dense(50, activation='relu', activity_regularizer=regularizers.l1(10e-5))(decoded)
	decoded = Dense(X_train.shape[1], activation='sigmoid')(decoded)
	network = Model(input, decoded)

	# sgd = SGD(lr=8, decay=1e-6)
	# network.compile(loss='mean_squared_error', optimizer='adam')
	network.compile(loss='mean_absolute_error', optimizer='adam', metrics=['mse'])

	# Fitting the data
	network.fit(X_train, X_train, epochs=2, batch_size=1, shuffle=True, validation_data=(X_valid, X_valid),
				callbacks=[EarlyStopping(monitor='val_loss', min_delta=0.00001, patience=20, verbose=0, mode='auto')])


	# Results
	recon_valid = network.predict(X_valid, batch_size=1)
	score2 = network.evaluate(X_valid, X_valid, batch_size=1, verbose=0)
	print('Network evaluate result: mae={}, mse={}'.format(*score2))

	x = Input((X_train.shape[1],))
	m = Model(x, x)
	m.compile(loss='mean_absolute_error', optimizer='adam', metrics=['mse'])
	score1 = m.evaluate(recon_valid, X_valid, batch_size=1, verbose=0)
	print('Identity evaluate result: mae={}, mse={}'.format(*score1))

	errors_test = np.absolute(X_valid - recon_valid)
	print("Manual MAE: {}".format(np.average(errors_test)))
	errors_test = np.square(X_valid - recon_valid)
	print("Manual MSE: {}".format(np.average(errors_test)))

Which outputs the following:

    Train on 282 samples, validate on 94 samples
    Epoch 1/2
    2018-04-18 17:24:01.464947: I C:\tf_jenkins\workspace\rel-win\M\windows\PY\36\tensorflow\core\platform\cpu_feature_guard.cc:137] Your CPU supports instructions that this TensorFlow binary was not compiled to use: AVX AVX2
    282/282 [==============================] - 0s - loss: 0.0861 - mean_squared_error: 0.0187 - val_loss: 0.0451 - val_mean_squared_error: 0.0025
    Epoch 2/2
    282/282 [==============================] - 0s - loss: 0.0440 - mean_squared_error: 0.0025 - val_loss: 0.0422 - val_mean_squared_error: 0.0024
    Network evaluate result: mae=0.04216482736011769, mse=0.0024067993242382767
    Identity evaluate result: mae=0.03506102238563781, mse=0.0024067993242382767
    Manual MAE: 0.03506102412939072
    Manual MSE: 0.002406799467280507

I know that my manual calculation is correct, since the identity model (m) returns the same value. The only possible explanation for the difference in MAE values would then be if network.evaluate(X_valid, X_valid) somehow uses different values than those returned by network.predict(X_valid), but then the MSE would also be different. 

This leaves me completely confused, thinking there might be a bug in the Keras MAE calculation. Has anyone had this issue before or have any ideas how it might be fixed? I am using the Tensorflow backend.
Any help would be much appreciated!

**EDIT: I'm almost certain this is a bug. If I keep loss='mae' but also add metrics=['mse', 'mae'], the MAE returned by the metrics is the same as my manual computation and the identity model. The same is true for MSE: if I set loss='mse', the MSE returned by the metric is different from the loss.**
items.title: Keras predict gives different error than evaluate, loss different from metrics
items.body:
I have the following problem:

I have an autoencoder in Keras, and train it for a few epochs. The training overview shows a validation MAE of 0.0422 and an MSE of 0.0024. However, if I then call network.predict and manually calculate the validation errors, I get 0.035 and 0.0024.

One would assume that my manual calculation of the MAE is simply incorrect, but the weird thing is that if I use an identity model (simply outputs what you input) and use that to evaluate the predicted values, the same error value is returned as for my manual calculation. The code looks as follows:

input = Input(shape=(X_train.shape[1], ))
encoded = Dense(50, activation='relu', activity_regularizer=regularizers.l1(10e-5))(input)
encoded = Dense(50, activation='relu', activity_regularizer=regularizers.l1(10e-5))(encoded)
encoded = Dense(50, activation='relu', activity_regularizer=regularizers.l1(10e-5))(encoded)
decoded = Dense(50, activation='relu', activity_regularizer=regularizers.l1(10e-5))(encoded)
decoded = Dense(50, activation='relu', activity_regularizer=regularizers.l1(10e-5))(decoded)
decoded = Dense(X_train.shape[1], activation='sigmoid')(decoded)
network = Model(input, decoded)

# sgd = SGD(lr=8, decay=1e-6)
# network.compile(loss='mean_squared_error', optimizer='adam')
network.compile(loss='mean_absolute_error', optimizer='adam', metrics=['mse'])

# Fitting the data
network.fit(X_train, X_train, epochs=2, batch_size=1, shuffle=True, validation_data=(X_valid, X_valid),
            callbacks=[EarlyStopping(monitor='val_loss', min_delta=0.00001, patience=20, verbose=0, mode='auto')])


# Results
recon_valid = network.predict(X_valid, batch_size=1)
score2 = network.evaluate(X_valid, X_valid, batch_size=1, verbose=0)
print('Network evaluate result: mae={}, mse={}'.format(*score2))

x = Input((X_train.shape[1],))
m = Model(x, x)
m.compile(loss='mean_absolute_error', optimizer='adam', metrics=['mse'])
score1 = m.evaluate(recon_valid, X_valid, batch_size=1, verbose=0)
print('Identity evaluate result: mae={}, mse={}'.format(*score1))

errors_test = np.absolute(X_valid - recon_valid)
print("Manual MAE: {}".format(np.average(errors_test)))
errors_test = np.square(X_valid - recon_valid)
print("Manual MSE: {}".format(np.average(errors_test)))

Which outputs the following:

Train on 282 samples, validate on 94 samples
Epoch 1/2
2018-04-18 17:24:01.464947: I C:\tf_jenkins\workspace\rel-win\M\windows\PY\36\tensorflow\core\platform\cpu_feature_guard.cc:137] Your CPU supports instructions that this TensorFlow binary was not compiled to use: AVX AVX2
282/282 [==============================] - 0s - loss: 0.0861 - mean_squared_error: 0.0187 - val_loss: 0.0451 - val_mean_squared_error: 0.0025
Epoch 2/2
282/282 [==============================] - 0s - loss: 0.0440 - mean_squared_error: 0.0025 - val_loss: 0.0422 - val_mean_squared_error: 0.0024
Network evaluate result: mae=0.04216482736011769, mse=0.0024067993242382767
Identity evaluate result: mae=0.03506102238563781, mse=0.0024067993242382767
Manual MAE: 0.03506102412939072
Manual MSE: 0.002406799467280507

I know that my manual calculation is correct, since the identity model (m) returns the same value. The only possible explanation for the difference in MAE values would then be if network.evaluate(X_valid, X_valid) somehow uses different values than those returned by network.predict(X_valid), but then the MSE would also be different.

This leaves me completely confused, thinking there might be a bug in the Keras MAE calculation. Has anyone had this issue before or have any ideas how it might be fixed? I am using the Tensorflow backend. Any help would be much appreciated!

EDIT: I'm almost certain this is a bug. If I keep loss='mae' but also add metrics=['mse', 'mae'], the MAE returned by the metrics is the same as my manual computation and the identity model. The same is true for MSE: if I set loss='mse', the MSE returned by the metric is different from the loss.

items.body_markdown:
I understand JMS Sessions are not thread-safe. However, if I attempt to acknowledge Message objects which are "stored" on Spark RDD's, is the session actually being accessed concurrently? How is routing made to acknowledge each message(s) (or a batch of them) session?
If that is indeed dangerous, any ideas on how could I safely consume JMS messages from Spark and acknowledge them after some validations?

Thanks in advance.

How is routing made to acknowledge each message(s) (or a batch of them) session? If that is indeed dangerous, any ideas on how could I safely consume JMS messages from Spark and acknowledge them after some validations?

Thanks in advance.

items.title: Error while trying obtain Azure Rate Card
items.body:
I am trying to download the rate card for my Azure subscription and since this morning the request is ending in an HTTP 400. This is the error 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Error>
    <Code>InvalidAuthenticationInfo</Code>
    <Message>Authentication information is not given in the correct format. Check the value of Authorization header.
RequestId:757bb26d-801e-005b-45e9-d7361f000000
Time:2018-04-19T14:19:26.9289239Z</Message>
</Error>

The Api Call I make is. In the header I also pass the access token. 

https://management.azure.com/subscriptions/<subscription id>/providers/Microsoft.Commerce/RateCard?api-version=2015-06-01-preview&$filter=OfferDurableId+eq+%27MS-AZR-0003P%27+and+Currency+eq+%27USD%27+and+Locale+eq+%27en-US%27+and+RegionInfo+eq+%27US%27

The same access token seems to be working fine for other purpose. But all of a sudden it seems the rate card API is failing.

Any ideas if anything changed on the Microsoft side ?

items.title: Trigger works, but the Converter in the Multibinding doesn't get activated
items.body:
The ControlTemplate has a LookUpEdit - its like a Combobox. When its open it shows a list of Elements from the Entity. The idea is to reduce the choice of this LookUpEdit.

As Solution the View of the List get filtered by a Value "SoftwareID" as soon it get clicked "IsFocused".

I build a Trigger, which get activated when the DropDown get clicked.

The FilterConverter format the Value SoftwareID and bring it back as FilterCriteria. Than it should reduce the choice of the LookUpEdit.

 <ControlTemplate x:Key="SoftwareVersionControlTemplate">

                <dxg:LookUpEdit ItemsSource="{Binding Source={StaticResource EntityServerModeDataSource5}, Path=Data}"
                                DisplayMember="Name"
                                ValueMember="ID"
                                EditValue="{Binding SoftwareVersionFN.ID}"
                                Name="LookUpEditSoftwareVersion"
                                >

                    <dxg:LookUpEdit.PopupContentTemplate>
                        <ControlTemplate>

                            <dxg:GridControl Name="PART_GridControl">

                                <dxg:GridControl.View>
                                    <dxg:TableView AutoWidth="True"/>
                                </dxg:GridControl.View>
                                <dxg:GridColumn FieldName="SoftwareID" Width="70"/>
                                <dxg:GridColumn FieldName="Name" Width="70"/>
                                <dxg:GridColumn FieldName="Description" Width="330"/>
                            </dxg:GridControl>

                            <ControlTemplate.Triggers>                             
                                <Trigger common:TriggerTracing.TriggerName="LookUpEditOpening"                                        
                                         common:TriggerTracing.TraceEnabled="True"                                        
                                         Property="IsFocused"                                        
                                         Value="True"> 
                                    <Trigger.Setters>
                                        <Setter Property="FilterCriteria" TargetName="PART_GridControl">
                                            <Setter.Value>


                                                <MultiBinding Converter="{modules:FilterConverter}"> 
                                                    <Binding Path="SoftwareID"/>
                                                    <Binding Path="IsFocused" RelativeSource="{RelativeSource Self}"/>
                                                </MultiBinding>
                                            </Setter.Value>
                                        </Setter>
                                    </Trigger.Setters>

                                </Trigger>                                                  
                            </ControlTemplate.Triggers>

                        </ControlTemplate>
                    </dxg:LookUpEdit.PopupContentTemplate>
                </dxg:LookUpEdit>

            </ControlTemplate>

Here it never goes into my FilterConverter, why? The Trigger I checked - this one works fine. As Target I like that the FilterConverter deliver the value from SoftwareID parsed to the FilterCriteria and filters the PART_GridControl.

public class FilterConverter : MarkupExtension, IMultiValueConverter
    {
        public object Convert(object[] values, Type targetType, object parameter, CultureInfo culture)
        {
            if ((bool) values[1])
            {
                return CriteriaOperator.Parse("[SoftwareID] == ?", ((Int32)values[0]).ToString());
            }
            return values[0];
        }

        public object[] ConvertBack(object value, Type[] targetTypes, object parameter, CultureInfo culture)
        {
            throw new NotImplementedException();
        }

        public override object ProvideValue(IServiceProvider serviceProvider)
        {
            return this;
        }
    }

items.body_markdown:
I have a barplot which ONLY shows rectangles I have created using the rect function. In each rectangle I have added text using the text function. I would like to have a hyperlink for each rectangle (or by clicking on the text in the rectangle). I am not even sure if this is possible to do. 

Below shows an example of my code...

    plot(c(0, 420), c(0, 155), type= "n", xlab = "", ylab = "", xaxt='n', yaxt='n')
    rect(0, 0, 75, 75, col="tan1")
    rect(0, 80, 75, 150, col="tan1")
    rect(85, 0, 165, 75, col="tan1") 
    rect(85, 80, 165, 150, col="tan1")
    rect(175, 80, 250, 150, col="tan1")
    text(38, 117, "One")
    text(38, 40, "Two")
    text(126, 117, "Three")
    text(126, 40, "Four")
    text(212, 117, "Five")

Many Thanks!

items.body_markdown:
From [Django Documentation][1]:
 
> Managers are accessible only via model classes, rather than from model instances, to enforce a separation between table-level operations and record-level operations.


  [1]: https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/topics/db/queries/
items.title: Does anyone know the difference between table-level operations and record-level operations
items.body:
From Django Documentation:

Managers are accessible only via model classes, rather than from model instances, to enforce a separation between table-level operations and record-level operations.
